file_content.text: Captain. I understand you've reached Balmorra--let's get straight to it, shall we?
Imperial forces conquered the planet during the first war, but a Balmorran resistance movement has fought the occupation to this day.
Republic support for the resistance has been... inconsistent, over the years. But now, our forces are pushing to drive the Empire off Balmorra for good.
If our people need backup, they can count on Havoc Squad.
I'll help wherever I can.
What brought on this sudden commitment?
Why the change?
We are at the brink of all-out war. Balmorra's industry is a strategic resource and cannot be allowed to remain in Imperial hands.
I didn't come here to win the war on Balmorra.
That's not my concern.
No, but as a soldier of the Republic, you are expected to assist Republic efforts whenever and wherever possible.
As on Hoth, your primary objective is the recruitment of a new soldier for Havoc Squad: an explosives expert named Tanno Vik.
Your primary objective, of course, is the recruitment of Havoc Squad's new explosives expert. His name is Tanno Vik.
Vik is a Weequay, and a natural at demolitions work. But he also has a history of insubordination and collateral damage. Keep him on a short leash.
I'm sure I can keep him out of trouble, General.
Understood.
I hope so.
What's a Weequay?
Weequay?
Weequay are leathery-skinned humanoids from a desert planet called Sriluur, in the Outer Rim, though Vik himself comes from Nar Shaddaa.
What good is this guy if he can't follow orders?
Sounds like a big risk.
You're an experienced officer. You can keep him in line.
To be clear: Vik's infractions were not minor, and they led to his dishonorable discharge over a year ago.
He is, however, the most skilled demolitionist on record--and Havoc Squad needs the best.
I'm sure he'll work out fine.
Sounds good to me.
Just be sure to keep an eye on him.
Fuse is still around, General. Couldn't I use him?
Why not Fuse?
Treason is a serious crime. Whatever his regrets, Fuse will never serve in an active field unit again.
I'll give the guy a shot, at least.
We'll see how it goes.
He is the only available explosives expert anywhere close to Havoc standards.
If this guy goes rogue, it won't be my fault.
This will be a disaster.
You are responsible for the actions of personnel under your command.
Vik is currently fighting as a mercenary for the Balmorran resistance. His supervisor is a resistance leader named Ardon.
Meet with Ardon, learn where Vik is stationed and pull him out as quickly as possible. Contact me again when you've done so. Garza out.
